name: 42 Macro
title: What Is The Current Health Of The US And global Economy?
text:
Synopsis
President Trump is poised to implement aggressive trade policies, including 25% tariffs on Canadian and Mexican imports, with a potential focus on China, which could significantly impact global economic dynamics and market volatility.

Key Insights
- Trump announced 25% tariffs on imports from Canada and Mexico, effective February 1st
- Auto industry will be heavily impacted, with major manufacturers importing significant percentages of vehicles from these countries:
  - Stellantis: 40% imports
  - General Motors: 30% imports
  - Ford: 25% imports
- China was initially excluded from tariff announcements, but Trump ordered an investigation into:
  - Unfair trade practices
  - Currency manipulation
  - China's compliance with the 2020 trade deal
- The administration suggests Trump will likely impose tariffs on China, potentially as a revenue source for extending Trump tax cuts
- Investors may experience temporary relief from US dollar strength in early months due to trade policy review and treasury account spending
- Additional hawkish economic catalysts are expected to emerge, potentially creating a global refinancing "air pocket"
